intro: Leandra flavescens, commonly known as the golden leandra, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers, which are typically clustered in panicles. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is known for its ornamental value. Leandra flavescens thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Its foliage is often glossy and dark green, adding to its visual appeal in botanical gardens and landscapes.
